result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew M Johnson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered a fine of $500. Court ordered a payment plan for the fine only in the amount of $50 per month with the first payment due on 12-15-2016 and additional payments due the 15th of each month thereafter.

-Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) to be paid by 05-04-2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank-surcharge imposed

Credit for 3 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE, COURT WILL ALLOW FOR EXPUNGEMENT

COURT ORDERED THE DEFENDANT TO WRITE A LETTER OF APOLOGY TO HIS MOTHER AND HIS EMPLOYER

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court PRO SE.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Return of Property Hearing proceeded. Court denied return of the gun and ammunition. Court grants return of defendant's gun case and sunglasses with their case. Order signed and filed.
Return of property hearing on February 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.

See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.
UPON SUCCESSFULY COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE, COURT WILL ALLOW FOR EXPUNGEMENT

Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statement made by Kevin T.

Court ordered defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction, with 3 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered 50 hours of community Service.
Court ordered a defendant to write a letter of apology to his mother and his employer.
Court ordered a fine of $500. Court ordered a payment plan for the fine only in the amount of $50 per month with the first payment due on 12-15-16 and additional payments due the 15th of each month thereafter.
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges(including DNA) to be paid by 05-04-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.
 
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Letters from defense

Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for jury trial.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Offer placed on the record by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and elements, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Court ordered defendant to submit a DNA sample.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 31 on 10-05-2016 at 8:30am.

Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is not ready to proceed with today's plea and sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 31.  Jury trial remains calendared for 10/5/2016 at 8:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for jury trial.  For reasons stated on the record, defense requests an adjournment and that the Court set both plea and sentencing hearing and jury trial dates.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing and jury trial in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court.  Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Attorney Brian Hagner is in trial before Judge Konkel, Branch 44.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Matthew M Johnson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Matthew M Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
